game

Class EvaluateHandCards

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.EvaluateHandCards

  • public class EvaluateHandCards
extends java.lang.Object
    A Helper Class which helps to evaluate the value of the card combination each player has.
    Author:
    Stefan Fuchs, Jan-Niklas Wortmann
    See Also:
    ArrayUtils, JSONObject, ArrayList, Arrays, Collection, List

    • Method Detail

      • getWinner

        public org.json.JSONObject getWinner(UserList active_players,
                                     Card[] board)
        This method evaluate the players combination by its value. It also has to check the winner when two players got the same combination.
        Parameters:
        active_players - All active player whose card combinations have to be evaluated.
        board - The cards which are on the board which belongs to the players combination.
        Returns:
        a json object with the winner user, his combination value and his cards.

      • getBestHand

        public org.json.JSONObject getBestHand(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cards,
                                       User user)
        This method evaluates the cards of a single user.
        Parameters:
        cards - A List of all cards (Handcards of the user + board cards)
        user - The user whose combination have to be checked
        Returns:
        a JSONObject with the user, his card combination and its value representation.
        See Also:
        Constants.Cards.HandValues

      • getRoyalFlush

        public Card[] getRoyalFlush(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cards)
        This method checks if the cards represents a royal flush. A royal flush is the card combination 10, jack, queen, kind and ace, all with the same symbol
        Parameters:
        cards - the cards which have to be checked if they represents a royal flush
        Returns:
        a card array if it is a royal flush else it returns null

      • cardsContainStraightFlush

        private Card[] cardsContainStraightFlush(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cards,
                                         int needed_value,
                                         Card first_card)
        This method checks if the cards contains a straight flush starting by the first_card
        Parameters:
        cards - all cards which could possibly contains a straight flush
        needed_value - the highest value of the straight
        first_card - needed for the symbol of the straight
        Returns:
        null when there is no straigh flush or the card Array holding the straight flush.

      • getStraightFlush

        public Card[] getStraightFlush(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cards)
        This method checks if the cards represents a straight flush. A straight flush are 5 cards in sequence, all in the same suit.
        Parameters:
        cards - the cards which have to be checked if they represents a straight flush
        Returns:
        a card array if it is a straight flush else it returns null

      • getQuads

        public Card[] getQuads(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cards)
        This method checks if the cards represents quads. This means there have to be four cards with the same value.
        Parameters:
        cards - the cards which have to be checked if they represents quads
        Returns:
        a card array if it is quads else it returns null
        See Also:
        sameAmountOfValues(ArrayList, int)

      • getFlush

        public Card[] getFlush(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cards)
        This method checks if the cards represents a flush. The card list have to contain five cards with the same value.
        Parameters:
        cards - the cards which have to be checked if they represents a flush
        Returns:
        a card array if it is a flush else it returns null
        See Also:
        sameAmountOfValues(ArrayList, int)

      • getFullHouse

        public Card[] getFullHouse(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cards)
        This method checks if the cards represents a full house. There have to be five cards of the same symbol
        Parameters:
        cards - the cards which have to be checked if they represents a full house
        Returns:
        a card array if it is a full house else it returns null

      • getStraight

        public Card[] getStraight(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cards)
        This method checks if the cards represents a straight. This means the card list have to contain 5 cards of mixed symbols in sequence
        Parameters:
        cards - the cards which have to be checked if they represents a straight
        Returns:
        a card array if it is a straight else it returns null

      • getTrips

        public Card[] getTrips(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cards)
        This method checks if the cards represents trips. This means the card list have to contain three cards with the same value.
        Parameters:
        cards - the cards which have to be checked if they represents trips
        Returns:
        a card array if it is trips else it returns null
        See Also:
        sameAmountOfValues(ArrayList, int)

      • getTwoPair

        public Card[] getTwoPair(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cards)
        This method checks if the cards represents a two pair. This means the card list have to contain two combination of cards with the same value.
        Parameters:
        cards - the cards which have to be checked if they represents a two pair
        Returns:
        a card array if it is a two pair else it returns null

      • getPair

        public Card[] getPair(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cards)
        This method checks if the cards represents a pair. This means their have to be two cards with the same value.
        Parameters:
        cards - the cards which have to be checked if they represents a pair
        Returns:
        a card array if it is a pair else it returns null
        See Also:
        sameAmountOfValues(ArrayList, int)

      • getHighCard

        public Card[] getHighCard(User user)
        High Card means only the highest hand card of the player.
        Parameters:
        user - needed to get his hand cards
        Returns:
        the highest card of the player

      • containsCardByValueAndSymbol

        private boolean containsCardByValueAndSymbol(java.util.List<Card> list,
                                             java.lang.String symbol,
                                             int value)
        checks the list if there is the given symbol and value
        Parameters:
        list - a card list which should be checked up
        symbol - the symbol which should be checked if it is in the list
        value - the value which should be checked if it is in the list
        Returns:
        true when symbol and value are in the list else returns false
        See Also:
        java.util.stream

      • containsCardByValue

        private boolean containsCardByValue(java.util.List<Card> list,
                                    int value)
        checks the list if there is the given value
        Parameters:
        list - a card list which should be checked up
        value - the value which should be checked if it is in the list
        Returns:
        true when value IS in the list else returns false
        See Also:
        java.util.stream

      • getIndexByValue

        private int getIndexByValue(java.util.List<Card> list,
                            int value)
        checks the index of a value in the given list
        Parameters:
        list - a card list which should be checked up
        value - the value which should be checked if it is in the list
        Returns:
        index of the value in the list

      • getCardsByValue

        private Card[] getCardsByValue(java.util.List<Card> list,
                               int value)
        Get a card array, where each card have the same value, from the list
        Parameters:
        list - a card list which should be checked up
        value - the value which should be checked if it is in the list
        Returns:
        the card array where all cards got the same value
        See Also:
        java.util.stream

      • getCardsBySymbol

        private Card[] getCardsBySymbol(java.util.List<Card> list,
                                java.lang.String symbol)
        Get a card array, where each card have the same symbol, from the list
        Parameters:
        list - a card list which should be checked up
        symbol - the symbol of a card which should be checked if it is in the list
        Returns:
        the card array where all cards got the same symbol
        See Also:
        java.util.stream

      • sameAmountOfValues

        private Card[] sameAmountOfValues(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cards,
                                  int matches)
        get a Card array, of a size equal to the parameter matches, from a card list where each card got the same value
        Parameters:
        cards - a card list which should be checked up
        matches - needed amount of equal values in the list
        Returns:
        a card array with the size of matches where each card got the same value
